annotation.message: An operand identifier reference is hiding another identifier of the same name.

a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SMalariaLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.Malaria schedule) * Schedule Table: 4-dose schedule */ library IMMZD18SMalariaLogic

def.name: First malaria dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: First malaria dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Malaria vaccines" and "Type of dose" = "Primary series") = 1

a:s.a:s: "One malaria primary series dose was administered"

expression.name: One malaria primary series dose was administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Malaria dose 1

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of the malaria dose 1

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: Child's birth

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date of birth"

a:s.a:s: "No malaria primary series doses were administered"
"First malaria dose from the primary series was administered"

operand.name: No malaria primary series doses were administered
First malaria dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Malaria dose 1 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date of birth" + 5 months

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Malaria dose 1 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: WHO recommends that the first dose of vaccine be administered from 5 months of age.

a:s.a:s: 'WHO recommends that the first dose of vaccine be administered from 5 months of age.'

operand.value: WHO recommends that the first dose of vaccine be administered from 5 months of age.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Malaria dose 1 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Malaria dose 1 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date.

def.name: Second malaria dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Malaria vaccines")

a:t.name: pseudocode

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Malaria dose 2 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: There should be a minimum interval of 4 weeks between doses.

def.name: Fourth malaria dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Fourth malaria dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Completed the primary vaccination series" = TRUE (where "Vaccine type" = "Malaria vaccines")"

a:s.a:s: "Four malaria primary series doses were administered"

a:t.value: Malaria dose 4

a:t.name: dynamicValue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Malaria vaccines") + 4 weeks

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Malaria dose 4 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Malaria vaccines") + 18 months

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Malaria dose 4 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: There should be a minimum interval of 4 weeks between doses. The fourth dose should be provided approximately 12–18 months after the third dose to prolong the duration of protection.

a:s.a:s: 'There should be a minimum interval of 4 weeks between doses. The fourth dose should be provided approximately 12–18 months after the third dose to prolong the duration of protection.'

operand.value: There should be a minimum interval of 4 weeks between doses. The fourth dose should be provided approximately 12–18 months after the third dose to prolong the duration of protection.

a:t.value: Malaria dose 4 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date.
